results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George”, the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera, and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.

results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Mike Lobell and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.

results.title: The Jolson Story
results.creator_credit: Alfred E. Green, Sidney Skolsky and Columbia
results.brief_description: An exuberant Hollywood biography of singer, Al Jolson. The film begins with Jolson’s life as the son of a poor cantor and traces his struggle to become America’s greatest entertainer. It features a great soundtrack of Jolson’s songs including “Mammy”, “April showers” and “You made me love you”. It received an Academy Award for Musical Score and Larry Parks was awarded the Best Actor Oscar for his portrayal of Jolson.

results.title: The Hunt for Red October
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Mace Neufeld and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Red October is a technologically superior Soviet nuclear submarine under the command of Captain Marko Ramius (Sean Connery). It is heading for the United States coastline and has the American government in panic mode who presume that the submarine is preparing for attack. Only one man is prepared to consider the possibility that there is another motive. CIA analyst Jack Ryan (Alec Baldwin starring in the role that later featured Harrison Ford) has a different idea; he thinks Ramius is defecting from the Russian navy and it’s a race to see whether Ryan can prove his case before the Russians catch up with Red October and the wayward Ramius. Based on the novel by Tom Clancy. Cast includes James Earl Jones, Sam Neill, Scott Glen and Joss Ackland.

results.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
results.brief_description: Janet Ames’ whole world crashes when she learns that her husband has been killed in the war while saving the lives of five other men. Feeling that the survivors had no right to live, she sets out to visit and confront each one. What eventuates though, leaves Janet with a new perspective on life, which is something she did not bargain for.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jim Painten, Robert A. Harris, Martin Scorsese and Cineplex Odeon Films
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: The Great Houdini
results.creator_credit: Melville Shavelson and American Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: A biographical dramatisation created from fact and fiction about one of America’s most fascinating performers and escape artists, Harry Houdini. “The Great Houdini” is a revealing film that provides an insight into his background, his family, his wife (played by Sally Struthers), and his rise to international fame. The memory of Harry Houdini still lives on today. Stars Paul Michael Glasser as Houdini, Ruth Gordon, Vivian Vance, Adrienne Barbeau, Bill Bixby, Peter Cushing, Nina Foch, Wilfred Hyde-White and Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: The Great Caruso
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Enrico Caruso was considered one of the greatest tenors ever known. Mario Lanza, himself a renown tenor, plays the title role. Studying Caruso’s recordings over some years, Lanza sings twenty-seven songs with such passion and sentiment that the result is an outstanding and worthy tribute to the talents of both tenors. The story traces Caruso’s career as a cafe singer through to his career at the famous Met. It also follows his happy marriage to Dorothy Benjamin played by Ann Blyth and the troubles he experienced with her family. “The Great Caruso” is a musical feast and includes favourite arias from composers such as Verdi and Puccini. Based on Dorothy Caruso’s biography of her husband.
